channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SOLR-3311] System Admin UI not loading memory graph
item.description: The memory graphs on the system dashboard don't show memory useage anymore.
item.summary: System Admin UI not loading memory graph

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Hm .. currently upgraded to Rev 1309273 and everything is okay there.

Could you check if /solr/admin/system?wt=json is available und compare it to previous versions or attach it to this issue and i'll do.

The next thing, the screenshots show only the memory bar - is the rest of the dashboard like you'd expect it / it was before? because the data we're using there is only from the /admin/system Handler

system?wt=json looks like it loads OK (from firebug)

The rest of the dashboard UI looks reasonable – it shows instance and JVM info

Ah, just a quick guess .. but, on windows there seems to be no system.uptime-property, which the code relates to. if you're already using firebug, i'm pretty sure that you'd see a "unknown property"-error on the Console-Tab? Will create a patch to handle that correctly.

ah yes: system_data.system.uptime is undefined

perhaps related, but for me the refresh arrow in the upper right does not do anything either....

Can you try this patch Ryan?

perhaps related, but for me the refresh arrow in the upper right does not do anything either....

not only related, it's exactly the same. the button triggers the same function that the initial page-load does

with the patch I now see:

data[key] is null

.text( data[key].esc() );

index.js (line 258)
d0h, yes .. "solr-spec-version":null is causing this. no idea why the spec-/impl-version information is missing, but the updated patch will default to - if there is no value available. now working?

thanks!

The spec-version does not show up if you aren't running from a .jar file (from eclipse or exploded .class files)

I committed this in 1309485
